availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Ewen (Montgomery and Powell County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane P. Williams Ewen. Father of Mary E. Ewen, Weden Ewen, John H. Ewen, Louisa Ewen, Margaret Ewen, Presley Ewen, Belvin J. Ewen, Henrietta Ewen, and William Ewen. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Gary Holder as a laborer in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District No. 2, p. 53B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 28.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct No. 2, pp. 139B-140A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053 , Powell County Births.
"Jane P. Ewen (1825-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 5375223, Accessed August 4, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5375223.
